Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Blazer \Blaz"er\, n. One who spreads reports or blazes matters abroad. ``Blazers of crime.'' --Spenser. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Blazer \Blaz"er\, n. 1. Anything that blazes or glows, as with heat or flame. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
2. A light jacket, usually of wool or silk and of a bright color, for wear at tennis, cricket, or other sport. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
3. The dish used when cooking directly over the flame of a chafing-dish lamp, or the coals of a brasier. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]
blazer n : lightweight single-breasted jacket; often striped in the colors of a club or school [syn: {sport jacket}, {sport coat}, {sports jacket}, {sports coat}]
